alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ap: ap_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps
alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: ap: ap b: b ps: ps

dbze.long_name: CloudSat simulator equivalent radar reflectivity factor

hybrid_height.z_bounds_factors: a: lev_bnds b: b_bnds orog: orog
hybrid_height.z_factors: a: lev b: b orog: orog

ocean_double_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a href: href k_c: k_c
ocean_double_sigma.z_factors: sigma: sigma depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a_coeff href: href k_c: k_c

ocean_s.formula:
z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i)*(1+s(k)) + depth_c*s(k) + (depth(j,i)-depth_c)*C(k) 
 where 
 C(k)=(1-b)*sinh(a*s(k))/sinh(a) +
           b*(tanh(a*(s(k)+0.5))/(2*tanh(0.5*a)) - 0.5)
ocean_s.z_bounds_factors: s: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth a: a b: b depth_c: depth_c
ocean_s.z_factors: s: lev eta: eta depth: depth a: a_coeff b: b_coeff depth_c: depth_c

ocean_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth
ocean_sigma.z_factors: sigma: lev eta: eta depth: depth

ocean_sigma_z.formula: for k <= nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i) + sigma(k)*(min(depth_c,depth(j,i))+eta(n,j,i)) ; for k > nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = zlev(k)
ocean_sigma_z.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev_bnds
ocean_sigma_z.z_factors: sigma: sigma eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev

smooth_level.z_bounds_factors: a: a_bnds b1: b1_bnds b2: b2_bnds ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2
smooth_level.z_factors: a: a b1: b1 b2: b2 ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2

standard_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: p0: p0 a: a_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps
standard_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: p0: p0 a: a b: b ps: ps

standard_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev_bnds ps: ps
standard_sigma.z_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev ps: ps

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

depth.long_name: Sea Floor Depth: formula term: thetao

eta.long_name: Sea Surface Height formula term: thetao

nep.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nep.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmophere due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land.
nep.comment: Natural flux of CO2 (expressed as a mass flux of carbon) from the atmosphere to the land calculated as the difference between uptake associated will photosynthesis and the release of CO2 from the sum of plant and soil respiration and fire.  Positive flux is into the land.  emissions from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

baresoilFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

cLitterBelow.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

fLitterSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fLitterSoil.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
fLitterSoil.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

cropFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

evspsblveg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
evspsblveg.comment: The canopy evaporation and sublimation (if present in model); may include dew formation as a negative flux.

cCwd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cCwd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
cCwd.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in woody debris (dead organic matter composed of coarse wood.  It is distinct from litter)

fVegSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegSoil.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
fVegSoil.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area from vegetation directly into soil, without intermediate conversion to litter.

cLitterAbove.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

gpp.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
gpp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

ra.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
ra.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land
ra.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]

fGrazing.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fGrazing.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Grazing on Land
fGrazing.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to grazing on land

nbp.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nbp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
nbp.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon from atmosphere into land, calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbon fluxes from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

tsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tsl.comment: Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as missing for grid cells with no land.

cLitter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

c4PftFrac.comment: Fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).

mrfso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrfso.comment: The mass per unit area (summed over all model layers) of frozen water.

cSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoil.comment: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.

landCoverFrac.comment: Percentage of grid cell area occupied by different model vegetation/land cover categories. The categories may differ from model to model, depending on each model's subgrid land cover category definitions. Categories may include natural vegetation, anthropogenic vegetation, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, glaciers, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.

rh.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rh.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land
rh.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)

rMaint.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rMaint.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Maintenance Autotrophic Respiration on Land

nppLeaf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppLeaf.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Leaf
nppLeaf.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP

treeFracSecDec.long_name: Total Secondary Deciduous Tree Cover Fraction
treeFracSecDec.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary deciduous trees.

treeFracSecEver.long_name: Total Secondary Evergreen Tree Cover Fraction
treeFracSecEver.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary evergreen trees.

pastureFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.

treeFracPrimDec.comment: Percentage of the entire grid cell  that is covered by total primary deciduous trees.

c3PftFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).

burntArea.comment: Fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by burnt vegetation.

grassFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

cRoot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cRoot.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in roots, including fine and coarse roots.

cMisc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cMisc.long_name: Carbon Mass in Other Living Compartments on Land

cSoilMedium.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoilMedium.long_name: Carbon Mass in Medium Soil Pool
cSoilMedium.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in medium (rate) soil pool. Medium means a lifetime of more than than 10 years and less than 100 years for reference climate conditions (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

cWood.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cWood.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in wood, including sapwood and hardwood.

prveg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prveg.comment: The precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

cSoilSlow.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoilSlow.long_name: Carbon Mass in Slow Soil Pool
cSoilSlow.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in slow soil pool. Slow means a lifetime of more than 100 years for reference climate (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

mrso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrso.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

nppRoot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppRoot.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Roots
nppRoot.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP

cVeg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cVeg.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

cLeaf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLeaf.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.

shrubFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

treeFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

cSoilFast.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoilFast.long_name: Carbon Mass in Fast Soil Pool
cSoilFast.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in fast soil pool. Fast means a lifetime of less than 10 years for reference climate conditions (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

nppWood.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppWood.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Wood
nppWood.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP

mrsos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
mrsos.comment: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the  soil layer.

treeFracPrimEver.long_name: Total Primary Evergreen Tree Cover Fraction
treeFracPrimEver.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by primary evergreen trees.

mrro.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrro.comment: The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

npp.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
npp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land

fHarvest.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fHarvest.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Crop Harvesting
fHarvest.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to crop harvesting

evspsblsoi.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

lai.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

tran.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tran.comment: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

mrros.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrros.comment: The total surface run off leaving the land portion of the grid cell (excluding drainage through the base of the soil model).

fLuc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fLuc.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change
fLuc.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to human changes to land (excluding forest regrowth) accounting possibly for different time-scales related to fate of the wood, for example.

mrlsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrlsl.comment: The mass of water in all phases, including ice, in soil layers.  Report as missing for grid cells with no land.

residualFrac.long_name: Fraction of Grid Cell that is Land but Neither Vegetation-Covered nor Bare Soil
residualFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by  neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

rGrowth.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rGrowth.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Growth Autotrophic Respiration on Land

cProduct.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cProduct.long_name: Carbon Mass in Products of Land Use Change
cProduct.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  landuse change.

fFire.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fFire.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO2 Emission from Fire
fFire.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

fVegLitter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegLitter.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
